Reviews.Title: “Jan is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel on the 16 arrondissement , the best is the consierge-Jan ! very professional and helpful with good suggestions and nice advice. The location is a little out of the way for most attractions and taxis take a while to come. For our weekend in Paris we choose the Sezz because of its modern furnishing, quite location and small size, we were not disappointed . The room was cozy (a little small but that is Paris) the bathroom clean and well organized. the only drawback is the lighting - it is not too well appointed to the bed, so hard to read. our bed was a little creaky and the walls are not too thick - some areas for improvement but all in all it was a very happy experience, one of the best we had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “He Sezz! She Sezz!!”
Reviews.Author: CL50
Reviews.Content: Sorry bad joke - Great hotel. We like champagne ans so when we walked in and got free champagne straight away we new we were going to enjoy this hotel. Great location, metro close by as Paris is not a city you can walk as its HUGH! Staff very friendly spa in the basement very private and open late good way to finish off an excellent night. Rooms are well designed glass wall between the room and the Bathroom V Sexy!! Oooh La La......

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chic and location great”
Reviews.Author: Faumun
Reviews.Content: Celebrated a 40th birthday in Paris, ending a 1.5 week stay in Paris, at this chic little hotel. A personal assistant ensures that your day goes off without a hitch, and the location is quiet and within walking distance to some of Paris's most famous attractions. Stayed in the PENTHOUSE with a view of the Tour Eifel, but, through a small window. The room was modern but, as with most small boutiques, noise was easily heard through to other PH Suites. The staff were most pleasant, and so attentive. My only comment on this hotel is that the bed's are HARD as rock. I was assured that this is normal in Europe, so, this maybe just a North American's soft touche comment :) I would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but romance”
Reviews.Author: technoelectra
Reviews.Content: Talk about romantic Paris.... I absolutely loved this boutique hotel. As soon as you walk in, they greet you with champagne. The lobby is ultra modern. The rooms are amazing. Well mapped out for the space they have. Great beds. But the bathrooms are the best... jacuzzi to die for. Room service is top notch and will bring you whatever you need. Totally made the trip

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: StOuenboy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stylish and comfortable room - a real home from home. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet neighbourhood but also very close to the Passy Metro stop. Quite an expensive stay but ideal for a treat or special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, quiet, great rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: Elliotcaus
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights over New Years Eve. The hotel is not a traditional Parisian hotel, it is a modern style, spacious, and the rooms are very quiet which is great for sleeping in. The staff at the hotel were excellent, they are even helping with sourcing Veuve Clicquot products weeks after our check out. Recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LinhChau
Reviews.Content: First of all, we just want to say that Yann (Personal Assistant) was as advertised. He and also Maria made our Paris trip a "friendly" experience. The Hotel is in a great location (clean, and safe and the Passy station is right around the corner) and a short stroll to the Eiffel Tower. The room was nice and clean (modern). We also like the large glass bathroom and the Acqua di Parma amenities. It also has a nice and hot steam room and spa on the -1 floor. The only thing that did not work for us was the wireless and internet connection in our room but that turns out to be a blessing - we were finally disconnected from the world for a few days. Would stay here again the next time we are in Paris. Thank you Yann and Maria...

Reviews.Title: “simply best”
Reviews.Author: jam85Wolverhampton
Reviews.Content: this was our second trip to paris and again we returned to Hotel Sezz, we stayed in the Suite and it was amazing, we are fortunate to have stayed in a number of amazing hotels around the world and Sezz is amungst our favourites, we love the semi open plan batroom, teh comfy beds and the location, the eifel tower is about 5mins away by foot. kep up the good work Sezz

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Eiffel Tower and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mumbailing
Reviews.Content: A really swanky boutique hotel, just 10 mins walk to Eiffel Tower. Despite being just off the main road, there is little noise to interrupt a good night's sleep. The room we had was a suite but the shower drainage didn't work and the bathroom flooded. The hotel staff informed us that there was no help on a Saturday evening, so we had to live with the problem and were given one big stack of towels to soak up the mess. The way I had described it to my partner was - the room is like a top model, swanky and beautiful, but she is an airhead (just like things do not really work in the room). Besides the flooding problem, we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Sezz.

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: expatinlondon17
Reviews.Content: this is a funky hotel in a rather staid and posh part of Paris. The staff was very helpful, if a bit slow in sorting things out on occassion. The room was quite cool and funky, and the internet worked right off the bat. My only real complaint was the mandatory breakfast charge they inform you will be put on your room. It was quite high and as a result I ended up having breakfast in my room since I was going to get charged anyways. But if you're going to offer ham and cheese as an option and you're in France, I'd expect some interesting artisnal cheeses (particularly for the price) rather than the standard international bland ones on offer. But other than that a lovely hotel, that just needs to tighten up on a few of the little things

Reviews.Title: “Quirky bijou”
Reviews.Author: Spikey2842
Reviews.Content: Well, Sezz is a strange one, but not necessarily in a bad way... It's fairly clean, although there was a wee bit of an unusual fragrance in the bathroom area on arrival (sorted by the cleaners the next morning), the room is average-sized for a hotel in Paris, and the amenities are very modern, with an iPod dock, a mobile-style room phone, and a wall-mounted flat-screen tv with a myriad of channels. What makes the Sezz different to any hotel we've stayed at before is the rather open-plan bathroom layout. Simply, there is clear glass the length of the divide between the sleeping area and the bathroom area. Translated, that means that you shower/bath in full view of whoever else you share a room with... Now, if that's your girlfriend, that's no big problem at all, but if you're with another relative or a friend who's a bit shy about their body, then it could be a real issue... As regards the room, it was done in a grey brick (mock brick?) design that carried through into the bathroom. There was a sofa built in beneath the tv, which acted as the spot to leave bags, and a desk occupied the space behind the headboard, complete with a few glossy magazines/books, and the usual pen and writing pad. The rest of the decor wasn't too hard on the eyes, and looked in a reasonable state, although the lighting in the room is a little on the dark side. We didn't bother to eat in the hotel, as breakfast was 28 euros per person, and there were perfectly good (cheaper and tasty!) alternatives in the Trocadero area, which is a five-minute walk from Rue Fremiet, where the Sezz is located. There is a spa in the hotel, which is free, but again we didn't avail as we were only in Paris for 6 days, so we were on the move for most of the day. Concerning the staff, they were friendly enough, the cases brought to the room, no problems with the check-in or check-out, and were for the most part unobtrusive, with the odd "bonjour" thrown in. The main plus point about the Sezz is the location. It is very close to the Eiffel Tower/Trocadero area, and the Passy metro station is just a minute away (out of the hotel, turn left, and left onto the main road, and look for the steps up and the metro sign). Passy is on one of the main metro lines that takes you directly to the Champs Elysees... Overall, we would recommend the Sezz, however there could be better deals pricewise for what you get, as for a few of the in-room amenities, you do have to pay, for example, a designer candle... In addition, there are a few surprise items lurking in a drawer attached to the bed... One of them being a double-ended lollypop... Use your imagination... you are in Paris after all...

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Mauro F
Reviews.Content: Sezz was a nice surprise for anyone willing to stay at a quiet yet fancy neighborhood. The room was enormous and the shower, the best I had ever had in Paris. |The amenities were Acqua di Parma and the beakfast very hearty. Would definitely stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: vladimirdasic
Reviews.Content: We just come back from Paris and we spent three days in Sezz. We were happy with a hotel, accommodation and service. The rooms are very nice and you feel very fancy while in hotel as it is really design design design. Bathroom was very nice and you can even use is as your own private spa. Location wise if you want to be close to Eifel Tour and Trocadero this is the perfect place although prices for the rooms are quite high and for breakfast as well (you can have nice breakfast in the city for 2 persons for the price of the breakfast in the hotel for one person i.e. EUR 28). Our room was looking at Seine but they also have a loft looking at Eifel Tour although the price for that starts at 1,000 EUR. Please note that there are some works on the building opposite to the hotel but we were lucky as they are not working over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing terrible... Just wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: SebastianVictoria
Reviews.Content: I don't mind paying a lot for things I perceive to get value from. This hotel didn't give me the feeling of good value for the cost of a junior suite. Designer rooms with peeling paint... Urine stains round the floor of the toilet make you go in on tip toes... The little things like 6 euros for a glass of water... Nice looking... Location is good.... Nothing terrible... but I wouldn't recommend. Found via Mr & Mrs Smith.

Reviews.Title: “Best designer hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RoRoTang
Reviews.Content: Just finished my trip in Paris and it's the 3rd time I stayed at the Hotel Sezz. Every staff there are so friendly and helpful, fluent in English, you really don't get much of this kind of excellent service anywhere else in Paris! Location is great as well, close to metro station and very convenient for shopping and sight-seeing. Nice and chic decor for a designer's hotel, some utilities are not too practical but it's acceptable. Overall speaking, I will still go back next time and highly recommend to people visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic luxury, incredible service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: slhTourist
Reviews.Content: Sezz was an incomparable experience! I called the hotel directly to book and asked them if I need to book for a previous night as well, as I would be arriving at 8 am. They checked their bookings and assured me that they would do their best to accomodate my early check in request. The personal assitant e-mailed me a couple of times to ask if needed any help with restaurant reservations and also arranged for a pick up car at the airport. So I was already impressed with the service, before I even stepped foot into the hotel. The check in process was the most welcoming experience I have ever had. Yann, my incredible personal assistant bounded out the door and minute my car arrived, and asked me to make myself confortable in their lounge, while he collected my passport. Within minutes, I was served a complimentary expresso, a crossaint and a madeline! Yann then proceded to deposit my bags in my room, and check it out before he invited me to follow him. Despite my 9 am arrival, I was shown to my room immediately. I had a suite on the 2nd floor - a living room with a separate bed room. It had ample closet space, a very nice desk area, and a sunny sitting area with huge windows. The bed was super comfortable and along one wall was the big, big bathroom. And yes, its see through. Though the loo is very private. So you need to be prepared for that. I was taken care of superbly by Yann and the rest of the staff. They really made me feel that "no request was too much" and proceded to accomodate me with such enthusiasm that I was ready with my next request in no time :) The restaurants recommended by Yann were just spot on, I had some incredible meals thanks to the hotel. The morning breakfast spread is fresh and ample. Room service was extremely quick and efficient. Treat yourself to a morning expresso everyday! One of the best things I liked about the hotel was its location. Its steps away from the Siene and the Eiffel Tower, so you get to see her at all hours of the day. And just behind the hotel, is a real Paris neighbourhood, with its cafes and little shops giving you an immediate respite from anything remotely touristy. If you are a young at heart couple and like your decor modern, your service invisible but efficient, the Sezz is modern luxury at its best. My only regret is that I was too busy to try the hamam! Thank you again Yann and team for an unforgettable experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Harris T
Reviews.Content: I would like to sincerely Thank all the team members working at Hotel Sezz. My fiancee and I had a very memorable stay in Paris and your hotel. Everyone was being very helpful. The personal assistant service is a big reason why we had such a good time. Yann took care of everything for us. I would recommend it to all of our friends visiting Paris in the future. I definitely don't mind paying a bit more for their superior service.

Reviews.Title: “Très Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: DanielNYC22
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a recent business trip. Great boutique hotel, great location, great staff & service. Room was very sleek with an awesome soaking bathtub. Spa was very sexy with spacious jacuzzi and steam rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but needs to up its game to be something special”
Reviews.Author: redstar2000
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Sezz. We got a half price deal, but it was still quite pricey, so I was expecting something pretty exciting. On the positive side, the location is quiet, the hotel newly fitted out in the trendy way you'd expect from a 'boutique' hotel, even if the overall effect was a bit 'cold' for my taste. A bit of effort and the place could really merit a five out of five. Areas where improvement is needed - My main complaint is that the bathroom in our room offered no privacy. Although you can't actually see the person who's sitting on the toilet, you can see their legs, see them getting up, etc. You are also in full view when in the shower or at the washbasin. This seems idiotic to me - I don't want to have to hide under the duvet or consciously turn away while my other half is in the bathroom. Perhaps this set up appeals to some people - it didn't appeal to me. The AC in the room was noisy at times and you couldn't adjust the temperature. We found the room too cold at times. To be fair, we didn't complain about this at the time, so maybe it could have been fixed. Breakfast was a shambles. Tables next to ours weren't cleared up, so we sat there having breakfast next to someone else's half-eaten croissants. The scrambled eggs and omelettes we ordered really weren't very nice at all. The hotel seems to pride itself on assigning you a 'Personal Assistant' rather than having someone at reception. The PAs are dressed in a strange uniform that makes them look like they are wearing pyjama tops - not very stylish or professional looking. The PAs are all very nice and speak ok English, but they came across more like students than people who were particularly knowledgeable or confident. One PA recommended we take the RER to a particular destination, only for us to find out, too late, that it wasn't actually running The jacuzzi and steam room downstairs were good when you consider the location. We were a bit surprised to see one of the PAs coming in for a shower though. I don't want to sound pretentious, but it's unusual to be sharing washing facilities with the staff. All this said, we enjoyed our stay and nothing major went wrong - for the Sezz to get a better rating though, they need to focus on the details.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and cozy hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: hellkity
Reviews.Content: We won this trip to Paris to stay at the Sezz, so its not like we chose it. From the very first minute since we arrived we were very well treated and with politeness. We were offered coffee/drink while waiting for the room which was really sweet, and we did got our room even tho we checked-in at 10am! The hotel street is really quiet and from the window we can see the river Seine and from the street see the Eiffel Tower and reach it within 10min walk! There is also a metro station just 2 min walk from the hotel which is very convenient. Hotel is small which makes it very personal, so the breakfast area is small and the breakfast itself is lovely! The fact that the hotel is pretty new(only 5yrs) makes it a little unknown to the taxi drivers, they never know where it is, or where is that street. The only thing that at first disappointed a little was that me and my fiancé, who were celebrating our anniversary, had massages booked, but unfortunately we couldnt have it together, and when we got to the room we understood why: it was too small!! Surprisingly on our check-out we had been charged some extra items from the mini bar that we didnt take, but it was immediately corrected and everything was sorted. In general we liked everything and we totally recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Just average...”
Reviews.Author: MarcinPL
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a quiet street, you can sleep with open windows. Well, you have to, as the AC was broken down and although they repaired it, setting a desired temperature was not possible. There is a second control for the AC in the toilet, but doesn't work at all. The room was on the top floor (71) and on a sunny day it was way too hot. The location has also some bad sides - no grocery and no good restaurants in proximity. Metro station is close, though and getting to a better area takes about 15 minutes. Breakfast was a nightmare. 3 people that were to service up to 7 tables couldn't manage it. When we came nobody asked us whether we would like to order tea or coffee. When we finally traced somebody (they all stay in the kitchen most of the time) we couldn't place our complete order as they were running away from us. We ordered eggs and coffee. Coffee arrived after 30 minutes when we were done with our breakfast. Eggs were never served. There were no plates and no glasses for milk or juice. They were not refilling juice for a long time. Most of the food was gone and never refilled. There are certainly better places for this money in Paris. On the bright side the design is nice and the cleaning lady was the nicest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_Buxley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and loved our stay. This design is elegant chic and well done throughout the hotel. The staff were very welcoming, and helpful with bookings and arrangements for nearby facilities and the hotel was superb. The rooms were a bit cramped and lacked layout space in the bathrooms but otherwise were beautifully designed with great furniture and a well thought out desk area. They could do with a coffee machine however. The locality is great with easy access to the Seine, Eiffel and Trocadero in close proximity. We were really comfortable and enjoyed our stay here and would certainly go back whenever we next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful - but quite badly managed”
Reviews.Author: Filippo_Randon
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a super-stylish hotel: sexy, beautiful, quiet. Another plus: the spa facilities. SO gorgeous. Unfortunately, the service is surprisingly (for such an expensive and beautiful hotel) sub-par. They start well, by serving you a nice champagne glass while you wait for your room, but it's downhill from there. The room service is absolutely dreadful. It comes from the bar as there is no restaurant on the premises. Croque Monsieur at Sezz is simply bread and ham. One night, I had to send back my ravioli from room service as they were still frozen.. maybe the microwave needs to be replaced? Anyway- I was on business but if you're there for pleasure (this hotel is mostly for that) you usually go out to eat. More importantly- maybe it's the configuration of the hotel (no reception) but the people working there rarely give you a big smile. After I left, they charged my card for additional mini-bar items I had consumed, without even an email to let me know. Also, I had booked a rate with 35Eur included at the bar, but they were never credited.. When I asked about it via email, they said it was for stuff at the bar and could not be applied to room service/minibar.. (although room service comes from the bar itself!!!). Anyway- If you plan on a stay without needing any kind of assistance from the staff and just enjoying the room, then go... Otherwise, look for better, more service-oriented hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: crockUK
Reviews.Content: Arrived late (23:00) and greeted by pleasant, helpful receptionist, by name and given swift registration. Room was faultless, sharp design, clean and homely. Location is second to none - close to Eiffel tower and the iconic Le pont de Bir-Hakeim bridge. Quiet location remote from the almost constant traffic noise elsewhere in Paris. Some may be accustomed to this level of service but our visit was our 25 year anniversary and had to be right - in short it was. Intriguing design provided constant amusement - a conscious balance between old and new; early 20th century building and 21st century design. Staff attention was faultless – helpful without being intrusive. Would I recommended this hotel – yes – ignore the chains, the ‘best location’ and go for the unknown – you’ll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Its amazing and awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Kzablanka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent and amazing The hospitatlity and the style is wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Aussiechef40
Reviews.Content: I think this has become my my favorite hotel. The staff are professional and attentive, Love the glass of champagne on arrival . The rooms are great I had a king size bed and the wi-fi is really good. Another bonus is that you`re only about 700m from the Eiffel tower . All in all a very good experience, I`ll definitely be returning here

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmiUna
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and pleasant. The location of the hotel was also a plus...we were close enough to walk and sightsee but didn't feel like we were in the middle of everyone else's vacation. I not only recommend Hotel Sezz, I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service and Attitude”
Reviews.Author: empresscatherine
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractively designed hotel and is very expensive. I booked for a Saturday and Sunday night in a suite for a total cost of 805 Euros excluding breakfast. When I arrived at 3pm (the appointed check in time) my room was not ready and I was informed it would not be ready for 2 hours. The lady on reception explained that this was not their fault (something to do with some other guests needing to be moved to another room). This was extremely inconvenient for me as my husband was due to arrive any minute having cycled from London to Paris over the last 4 days and really wanted to get into the room more or less right away (for obvious reasons). I was extremely annoyed that they did not take responsibility for the problem or offer any kind of recompense (to be honest, a bottle of champagne in our room would probably have been enough to placate me). I asked for a discount (which I was not given when I checked out) and I didn't follow up on that because, to be honest, I didn't want to end up having the argument that would inevitably have followed. Not having the rooms ready is unaccceptable in any hotel (it is part of the contract after all) and in a hotel charging this much? Also I was very unimpressed with tiny bath in room 24 (huge bathroom though). I work for a French company and stay in Paris regularly and there are many better options for much lower price. Don't book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymoon & everything else”
Reviews.Author: WalkYBNYC
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about this place. We hadn't been to Paris in 3+ years and wanted a romantic honeymoon, it sure delivered. It's like being in your own private apartment. The staff is superb, and guided us to great nightlife, eateries, sights, etc (and told us what to steer clear of since some places fade after 3 years). They are gracious, friendly and tolerant of our awful French. They use a "Personal Assistant" concept so it is very guest-friendly. Our room was on 4th floor, #44, faced a courtyard so it was quiet and very easy to sleep (think there are only 3-4 rooms per floor). Very comfortable bed, 2 TVs, dual sinks in bath plus sep shower/tub, rock out to your i-pod, reas. price bar-nice sized suite for price. 24-hr room service, great food. We mainly worked w/ Cyril, Yann, Germain, Kersara, Alicia-all extremely friendly & gracious. Great neighborhood and easy walk to Passy metro (very safe at all hours btw). B/c the 16th is such a great res. neighborhood, non-touristy bakeries, cafes, pharmacies, groceries are right by Pl. Costa Rica/Passy. Staff will arrange all transport if you wish, esp late night. Walk to Eiff. Tower. This place is a welcome relief from stuffy Paris hotels, and seemed to cater to all ages/nationalities-very diverse group staying there (though you hardly see anyone b/c it is so private). We'll be back ASAP-also b/c we never had time to enjoy the spa and hear great things!

Reviews.Title: “"cool", top quality but not stuffy.”
Reviews.Author: MrsACG
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Stylish, chic and quiet, giving a very exclusive feel. The staff are ultra professional but friendly and helpful. Cyril deserves a mention. Good location, on a quiet street but close to Metro and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic setting & even better staff”
Reviews.Author: Tomf-notts
Reviews.Content: I treated my partner of 7 years to a trip tp Paris with the intenhtion of returning engaged. Obviously I wanted everything to be perfect and the hotel certainly played its part. Fantastic rooms, modern, clean & relaxing yet the location not to far from all of the main attractions within Paris. The stand out factor for us was the staff. From start to finish they were fantastic & woere full of great ideas and recommendations for restuarants & activities. If you are travelling to Paris you must seriously consider this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet hotel in the 16th”
Reviews.Author: sjdnorth
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be greeted by a charming man, who offered us a glass of Veuve Clicquot (complimentary) to drink while we checked in. Very smooth and easy check-in. We then asked for help with reservations for a couple of restaurants - no problem (there was a real "can do" attitude from all of the staff). We stayed in a suite, which was nicely done. Some elements owed more to style than practicality (eg towel rail in a location which you needed to step into the bath to reach; slight lack of storage / surfaces to put books etc on) but overall we were very happy with the room and bathroom. The bed was fabulously comfortable - pretty important following hours of walking around Paris! Breakfast was good - cold meats / smoked slamon plus some cheeses, breads, cereals etc. Also some less standard items such as Lebanese (I think) pastries. Coffee was not great but overall a very good start to the day. There is no restaurant for lunch or dinner but there are of course plenty of restaurants nearby - try Akasaka for excellent sushi / sashimi and Desgranges for delicious cakes and pastries. There is also a small spa in the basement - jacuzzi, and steam room; very peaceful as the staff tried (successfully in our case) to ensure that only one "set" of guests use the space at any one time. Overall a really good hotel; quite expensive but we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great modern hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mwils0n
Reviews.Content: The staff, rooms and location all exceeded expectations. Less than a five minute walk to Passy metro, and only 10 mins to Trocadero. The staff were extremely helpful. Would definitely go back with a partner, very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Wish my flight had been cancelled. I did not want to leave the Sezz :)))”
Reviews.Author: surfkitten2010
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity of staying at the new Sezz in St Tropez during the summer which was over the top and incredibly memorable. So at the request of a colleague, I thought I try out the Hotel Sezz in Paris. I'm not one who is fond of most Paris hotels but the Hotel Sezz exceeded my expectations. The staff made my brief stay incredibly enjoyable. The service was impeccable and the accommodations were top notch. I especially loved the bathtub which I couldn’t pull myself away from. The décor is modern, yet warm and the room was very functional. The Sezz thought of everything within its design. A truly elegant stay and I cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, excellent quaint location, smooth service!”
Reviews.Author: marc_maddie
Reviews.Content: From Montreal. We stayed 4 nights at the hotel (suite) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The service was impeccable - don't hesisate to ask the staff for any restaurant recommendations/locations (we ate at Pershing Hall, recommended by the staff, a super stylish ambiant restaurant that we would have never found on our own). The room we had was a good size (suite) and the overall design was really in the spirit of boutique hotels. The room was also very quiet during the night and morning - a plus when dealing with jet lag. We would highly recommend the hotel for anyone looking for a quaint lauch point for visiting and shopping in Paris... Comment to the hotel management: Very minor items! 1) Light control for the glass-enclosed shower is difficult to use. I would recommend a simpler attenuator design. 2) The bathroom products are quite nice, but would suggest adding hair conditioner to the selection.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suite - entrance area and reception could be much better”
Reviews.Author: kslawi
Reviews.Content: We just return from a weekend trip to Paris where I met some customers. I stayed with my family in the Eiffel Suite which is a wonderful, nicely decorated two room suite with a REAL view on the Eiffel tower. My daughters loved it very much as it was their first visit in Paris. Beds, bathrooms, furnishing - perfect! Our arrival at 8pm on friday evening was't perfect. We didn't like at all the style of the lobby and the way how we were placed on a sofa i a corner to wait for the registration. No drink was offered but in any case we were happy to be in the room after ten minutes. I really prefer the classical way - reception, credit card, passport, room key... I tried the breakfast the first morning, not bad, but nothing special. The biggest problem is that as usual in Paris the breakfast room is a small, narrow place without a view (there is a glass roof which gives light but no real view...). In my opinion the breakfast is too expensive. Fortunately on Sunday we had breakfast at Ladurée. For the same total price the quality of the food was much better and we had a perfect view on the Champs-Elysée. Check-out was good and effective, nothing to say. In total we liked the room, we like the quite and convenient location. We didn't like very much the other parts of the hotel (lobby, breakfast room. If I would like or have to stay in this part of Paris I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “One if my best Holidays yet”
Reviews.Author: JMcDandTHanlon
Reviews.Content: We left for Paris on the 29th of October for a 3 night stay in The Hotel Sezz. I was greeted with many e-mails a few days prior to leaving, confirming an queries i had from my Personal Assistant (a joint effort from Valerian and Magali) When we arrived we were greeted with a complimentary glass of Champagne as we waited for our bags to be taken up to our room and confirmed all our booking details. Our room was number 33 and was spacious, had a single bath (not what i requested) a huge bed and the usual tv, dvd player and all the khiels ammenities. despite certain aspects of the room not being to the requested specification (Probably my own fault) the service and facilities were second to none. The location of the hotel was very good. We walked everywhere (Champs elysees, Arc de Triomphe 30 - 40 mins, Eiffel Tower 5mins) we also walked along the Siene which is rite outside the hotel and a perfect spot for a champagne picnic with a view of the Eiffel Tower (a day the 2 of us will never forget) PERFECT!!! We didn't try any of the Hotels food on offer so cant comment on this, however we had read a couple of previous comments regarding this and when we had a look at the menu it seemed a little over priced for what was on offer. That being said there was no shortage of restaurants and a couple of shops around the hotel which catered to anything we required. If and when i return to Paris, i will most definitely use The Hotel Sezz. AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE WE WILL BOTH NEVER FORGET!!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous bathroom but old and average service”
Reviews.Author: TomKuhne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is out of centre situated on the calm Northern site of the Seine, 15 minutes walking to the Eifel tower and 5 minutes to Metro Passy with connections to the Arc de Triomphe. The design boutique-hotel has well designed and spacious rooms dominated by the dark stone walls and the abstract furniture. The adabtable in-room lighting adds a cozy ambiance to the room. The wooden floor, buro and carpet are ready for renewal as they look used. In the room is a big flat screen tv, dvd-player (with complimentary dvd's) and a ipod-speaker. The highlight of the room is the modernistical designed bathroom with a Japanese bath. Room service is not worth the price for microwave prepared, small portion. The service in the hotel is basic due to the less professional staff. Friendliness, hospitality and politeness could improve! Intercontinental breakfast was average as everything usual was there but nothing else. Clearing was to slow in the breakfast room which caused dirty tables! It is definately a nicely designed hotel and the bathroom is marvelous and romantic! But it's old, overpriced for the service delivered and the staff is average!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms isolated location and bad Internet connection”
Reviews.Author: jeanneetic
Reviews.Content: The no check in counter is a little weird and while rather cool can be this hotels undoing as the duty staff seem to have multiple tasks to deal with all at once. The hotel is in a great street and you know you are in Paris the minute you arrive, the rooms are roomy and the bed and pillows comfortable the bathrooms even spacious and with kheils products rather luxurious, when we wanted bookings to the crazy horse the staff got us one that night and also arranged cabs, the breakfast included was substantial and suitable and the location quiet. The distance from st Germaine etc proved to be great for me as we walked for hours every day to visit the lourve, notre dame etc however not good for my partner who is a reluctant walker. It is very close to the Eiffel tower and close to George v street for shopping etc however massive void of good food close by and we couldn't locate a convenience store anywhere for essentials. We would recommend this hotel for it's great rooms and proximity to the river however not for proximity to other tourist attractions or the st germaine precinct. A major concern was that the Internet wasn't up for 2.5 days of our 4 day stay and we had to lug our notebook to an Internet cafe an hours walk away (staff advised this was the closest) to conduct essential business transactions. It is improtant to note It was also a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic (?) getaway...”
Reviews.Author: NLBanker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, alone. I was welcomed by friendly staff with a glass of wine, before being taken to my room. It was on the top floor, but on the front so from there I could not see the Eifel Tour, which is only a five minute walk away. The bathroom has some design features for the sake of design only and is thus mostly impractical. An attraction to the room is what I will call the adult minibar and I do not mean alcoholic drinks... It contains scented candles, condoms, nipple docarations and you can order even more erotic goodies from reception. So if you are thinking of going away for a hot weekend: this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Taking Transparency to a New Level”
Reviews.Author: Vinoalvita
Reviews.Content: In a city where everything seems to be "classique", the Hotel Sezz provides a modern alternative. Situated on a small side street one block from the Seine, very near the Passy Metro stop and just across the river from the Eiffel Tower. they try to do everything a little bit differently. There's no registration desk as such. You are escorted to a small lounge, asked if you'd like something to drink (a glass of Veuve Clicquot is never out of place), while someone in a small office area does all the paperwork. While you're sipping your Champagne, your bags are whisked up to your room and once everything is ready, you're escorted up. We had junior suite with a small sitting area and a seperate bedroom. The surprise is that the bathroom wall is completely glass, as is the shower stall. Now this didn't both us, but I could imagine other for whom this would be uncomfortable. The bed itself was very comfortable. Storage overall wasn't great. There was a limited amount of space to store things if they weren't on hangers, and there was nowhere to hide the suitcases. The neighborhood is very quite and seemed very safe--there are a couple of embassies nearby, which probably means that area is being paid attention to. There weren't a lot of places to eat in the immediate area, but just beyond the Metro station there were plenty of options--and, of course, the Metro will take you anywhere in Paris. One strange event that occurred, was that one night when we returned about 11:00 pm, the front doors were locked. Someone came pretty quickly when we rang the bell, but it was a bit odd. Overall, I like the Sezz, but I don't think it's for everyone, particularly those who want a more traditional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karina_2010_11
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris from Los Angeles, an amazing experience. The service at the hotel was really good. I booked the rooms directly from the website with an option for an upgrade which we received upon arrival. The exterior of the hotel building makes you feel that you are in Paris full of history, and the contemporary touch of the interior compliments to the luxury of the hotel. Eifel Tower is walking distance away and metro station is conveniently located a block away. I can hardly imagine a better location for stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhlpenna
Reviews.Content: Great service, really comfortable bed, spacious room and bathroom with outstanding design!!! Could use though a better accustic regarding the corridor noise, but nothing that undergrades it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlelollyt
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend break at Hotel Sezz. I trawled for ages through Mr & Mrs Smith, Trip Advisor, Chic Boutique type of site to find the perfect place to stay in Paris. I was not convinced about Sezz due to some bad reviews but was glad I went with my gut instinct and booked it! It is a very small boutique hotel, no lobby (which I did not find odd at all) You are greeted as soon as you step in the door, given a well needed drink and shown to your room. There is no fluff but just a good courteous service from very attentive staff. Room was smaller than the website looked but this is Paris and this was big compared to other rooms. Amazing design, stunning bathroom and very very clean! We were unlucky as we were woken up at 9am on our first morning by banging from the building next door (nothing to do with the hotel just bad luck) we complained and we were given another room immediately, no fuss at all. Cabs all booked and came on time, breakfast was included and very satisfactory. All of our needs were very attended too immediately. The only negative I felt was the location, it is a very quiet street near Eiffel Tower (but near the metro) in hindsight we may have been better nearer Monmatre but that is really the only fault I can find. Staff lovely and helpful, I would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: kato65824
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at Sezz for 2nights. We really enjoyed our stay and we very much relaxed. The staff were very polite of Sezz, the room was very comfortable and very cool design. We want to stay at this hotel When We will come back to Paris in near future.

Reviews.Title: “stunning rooms but shabby service”
Reviews.Author: Cupcake16mt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the 16th arrondissement. It is in a quiet residential side street, within walking distance of restaurants surrounding the Trocedero and just a couple of hops on the (conveniently near) Metro to the Left Bank. The first words that greeted me from reception (which is situated in a cupboard off the main foyer) was 'passport please'. The room was stunning - very funky with great en-suite bathroom and mirrored shower. We could also see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our window, which flashes at night adding to the whole I'm in Paris experience. We were woken at 7.00 by the service cupboard door outside our room being open and shut - open/shut - open/shut - arghhh. Breakfast was also a disaster - no crockery or service... We ordered a taxi that evening, which was forgotten about until we chased... The hotel has the location and rooms to potentially be amazing...but sadly it isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and personal”
Reviews.Author: pflamend
Reviews.Content: A very personal welcome while there is no reception desk. The staff is motivated and happy, so it 's reflected to the customers. Beautiful rooms, but the acoustical insulation can be better, as well the quality of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good design, friendly and professional staff and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: revilo_berlin
Reviews.Content: After a ten-hour-drive (due to a flight-cancellation) we arrived at Paris a little tired, but the warm, friendly yet professional welcome to the hotel (including luggage and car-parking-service and a glass of champagne!) made us forget the strenous trip and had us relaxed and ready for Paris sightseeing in an instant. All the weekend of our stay we enjoyed the excellent service, the quiet and comfortable room in a very elegant street and the close proximity to some of the sightseeing hotspots of Paris. Hôtel Sezz is definitely a recommendation for a relaxing visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBlossy
Reviews.Content: The decor is very contemporary and stylish and the rooms comfortable, although the towels were almost threadbare. We were met by a very friendly and helpful young lady who immediately offered us a drink and was very pleasant and helpful. However, the following day we came back to our room at 3 pm and it had not been made up. COnsidering this is a 4 star hotel with not many rooms, this was poor. Although a few toiletries were supplied including shampoo, there was no conditioner. We rang down to the concierge but he was very unhelpful and said they didn't have any. We noticed when we left the hotel later that there's a pharmacy 5 minutes away, so it would have been helpful if he'd mentioned this. The breakfast was very disappointing, considering it was 28 euros a head. We arrived downstairs at 9 am (breakfast is served until 11am) and there wasn't a great choice. So, a comfortable hotel in a quiet and upmarket location, close to the metro, but very mixed service and very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: marsimlondon
Reviews.Content: I booked Sezz hotel through Eurostar as it was surprise for my partner 30th Birthday. With the 1st email I sent to Sezz the communication was just splendid. Two members of staff at Sezz: Audrey and Magali made our stay magnificent untill the last minute. I went through few review websites before booking the hotel so I knew what could I expected. Nevertheless smiley faces, very clear introduction to the hotel, fantastic decor and all suggestions from Magali where to go for a breakfast, lunch and diner...just blown me away. Hotel taxi from Eurostar station Gare du Nord would cost you 40euro, normal taxi 20-25euro. I ask for the top floor standard room - ideally nr 52 and I got it. Fantastic bath, very stylish, divided with glass wall from the main bedroom in which queen size bed is the key point in a whole room. Located just in the middle. Very comfortable (this might have different opinion depend of what kind of matterace you prefer - soft or hard). Massive window throughout one wall make room spacious, bright and light. Safe, spacious wardrobe, clean and tidy. I absolutely love the sink designed by Christophe Pillet as well as front door vase. This boutique hotel is perfect for a short city break. Perfect location - jus a stone from Eifel Tower, metro station Passy, great restaurants and breakfast places. I would recommend Zebra Square restaurant - 10 min away from the hotel as well as gorgeous patisserie near by Passy. Ask for any room with 2 in the end 22, 32,42,52. I already plan my next trip to Paris and would definitely stay at Sezz. Comment added by: http://marsim.webs.com/

Reviews.Title: “Strange feeling”
Reviews.Author: natetjl
Reviews.Content: Sezz is definitely not an hotel like others. We are French and as we are leaving abroad we would like to book an hotel in the XVIth arrondissement, something different than usual ACCOR SOFITEL , MARRIOT... and others. I was looking for a Design Hotel and the price, location looks good for a 4 star hotel. First there is no desk in the lobby. It's like entering a private property. You can meet hotel staff at the breakfast only for the service. They are efficient, professional but so discreet than you feel a bit alone there. Also the decoration of the hotel, design for sure, is a bit cold. Something is missing to get a real 4star service level, but It's just a strange feeling, nothing concret as a hair drier missing. It's a kind of experience for people found of design and grey colour.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Julia032
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just come back from a three day stay at the Sezz Hotel and are absolutely delighted. It was a very special trip, as my boyfriend proposed to me during our stay. Our room was adorable with a lovely big round bath tub and a wonderful feel to it, so my bf actually decided to propose to me in the room! The service is very friendly and we felt very welcome. Sezz is the perfect mix of luxury hotel and cosy feel, I can highly recommend it! Julia, London

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room”
Reviews.Author: DiManMilan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel only for one night in one of their suites (not the one with Eiffel Tower view). The hotel was amazing and people working there very helpful. When you arrive at the hotel there is not a reception but the employees will welcome you on a nice sofa which is near the entrance and offer you something to drink while you wait for the check-in procedure is done. The suite was divided into two separate rooms and a beautiful bathroom which was divided from the bedroom by a glass wall (obviously transparent). The hotel is ideally located to visit the Eiffel Tower and the surrounding area. However, it is quite far from other area like the Latin Quarter and the Marais. we enjoyed being at the Sezz and would definitely suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Lebo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day Trip in Paris in this well designed and luxurious Hotel. The personal was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was big enough and the bathroom sensational, with a large tub. A good continental breakfast is served and brought to you in your room if you choose. The Hotel location is perfect less than 5 min walking from Metro (Passy station) and 10 min walking from the Tour Eiffel. I can highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a romantic, comfortable and special hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller750
Reviews.Content: We booked their best room. very disappointed with our stay, bad customer service, and when our breakfast took so long to arrive, it was wrong, we couldnt get hold of anyone on the phone, there was food and stains on our room menu. when we mentioned it to the staff we were given the brusgh off, . we were so dissappointed with the lack of service that we booked into another hotel, and they are still charging us full price for the room the day we left, even though we left before checkout time. we wrote a letter and the response was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Ihcinho
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a Junior Suite and paid €535,00 per night . Couldn't sleep cause matress was covered with plastic, making uncomfortable sensation and some noise. Asked for Japanese food and it was a confusion with the reception desk ( which by the way don’t exist – is more like a closet with a face to the wall’s desk) cause we should booked it with 2 hrs in spite of the room service card state we could order until 10.00 pm. After spoke with another person they have accepted our order which took 2 hrs to arrive and was served as it came from the take away restaurant. In a plastic box, no dishes and papper napkings. Even thought we have ordered for a deluxe sushi to sashimi and got something else that wasn’t listed. We had to eat that ( terrible food ) but only after the employee come to our room and count the pieces to get the conclusion the order was wrong. We paid €535,00 per night and since staff is very poor English this 4 hours indoors was a battle.

Reviews.Title: “Personable & Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeGraySydney
Reviews.Content: Sezz is a lovely Paris base. We stayed for 4 days and in that time got to know our personal assistants very well. Nothing was too much trouble and our daily friendly exchange made Sezz very personable. Our Double King room was quiet (important to us), elegantly appointed and spacious. Its 16eme location worked for us with easy access to Paris by metro and foot. Only one small criticism and that was the local knowledge of our PAs was not always the best.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMR
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sezz turned out to be one of the best boutique hotels we've ever stayed at. The contemporary design of the interior, very friendly & helpful staff, the proximity of all tourist attractions and the lovely neighborhood of Passy make Hotel Sezz very unique. The property has a built in function of a Personal Assistant - a person, who will literally help you with anything in Paris. Our designated Personal Assistant helped us with wedding arrangements and was our eyes and ears for the entire week we stayed at Hotel Sezz. I highly recommend this hidden gem to anyone looking for a comfortable and quiet hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Style but not much substance”
Reviews.Author: bakingcakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights which was probably 2 nights too long - the rooms are cool - in the 'hip' sense of the word and but the hotel itself is not a fun place to hang out - plus there is a limit to the comfort factor of modernism which starts to show after a couple of days- the bed was set in the middle of our room and the sharp corners caught both of us out after day 2. The location is ok, but there is nothing close enough to the hotel to make it a wander-around-a-kind-of place. The concierge recommended an up coming restaurant in Paris which was the worst meal of our trip- a massively over priced place full of wannabes - ( like the restaurant at the St Martin's Lane Hotel London) a bit plastic and soul-less - so that marred things a bit for us. It is an expensive hotel relative to the amenities it offers - if you can do, choose the Costes instead, or the Kube ( which has an icebar and is really good fun to stay in and is busy enough to offer some great people watching) both of which are trendier and better value for money than the Sezz. Overall I was disappointed, it was quiet, and a bit dull, and overall , not comfortable either.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the 16e”
Reviews.Author: Annaclare
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sezz for 3 nights while in Paris for a wedding. We've spent lots of time in Paris before and have usually stayed in the Marais or St Germain des Pres. This time we were attending a wedding in the 16e so wanted to stay close by. We loved discovering a new part of the city: it's more residential than some other areas, quieter, but with great local restaurants and cafes and attractive art nouveau architecture. We took a wander towards the Bois de Boulogne on a nice day and enjoyed both the walk and the park. We also grabbed velib' bikes one evening (there's a station not far from the hotel) and rode along the riverbank to the Marais for dinner. I would probably not recommend the hotel for a first visit to Paris if you're focussed on seeing the sites. It's a wonderful location and Paris is small anyway, but it's not super-central and not on the best metro line. Back to the hotel itself: loved the bathroom (roomy and stylish), ipod dock and overall design of the place. Rooms aren't huge, but are really pretty big by Paris standards. Had room service one lunch before rushing out to the wedding ceremony - a little pricey, but very good and some more interesting dishes than usual. Staff were young and energetic and very helpful in their self-titled roles as "Personal Assistants". Will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, quiet, friendly base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: N7tripper
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms, lovely bathroom, quiet location in a nice area but close to the Metro, making most of the sights and attractions easily accessible. Staff were very helpful and friendly, and even arranged for a birthday cake for me (since the trip was a birthday present for me). Not the cheapest place to stay in Paris but at least you know you are getting somewhere decent for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Super-modern designer hotel near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Nga_Mihi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, small modern boutique hotel with excellent designer taste all round. Looks exactly like pictures on hotel website (www.hotelsezz.com) PROS * refreshing welcome drink upon arrival e.g. freshly squeezed juice, superb tasting coffee; * super modern looking waiting area (lobby) overflowing with minimalist designer touches; * friendly efficient English-speaking staff assigned to personally assist you at check in/ out; * slick architecturally designed bedroom + balcony with hidden oversized bathroom; * plenty of mod-cons in room e.g. iPod doc, mood-setting lights, quality furnishings and fittings (all top designer quality); * luxurious large bathrooms with quality toiletries; * reliable wireless internet in the room and hotel lobby; * well located including a short walk (5 - 10 mins) to/ from Eiffel tower. CONS * pricey room rates (but completely worth it if you are willing to splurge); * small slow hotel elevator (barely enough room to fit x2 people and 2 small suitcases); * no pool or gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pnini00
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking about this Hotel for your romantic getaway in Paris you are definitely on the right way! I spent so much time to look for the nicest and coolest location for a very special romantic hotel in Paris and I finally succeeded! We have been 5 nights in hotel Sezz in a very beautiful junior suite at the 5th floor with a squared stone thub sited in a luxury bathroom. Hotel location is very nice (<5 min walking from Passy station) and 10 min walking from the Tour Eifelle (which you can see through the window from hotel stairs). You get a personal assistant from the staff who will guide you through all the facilities and services of the hotel as well as through any need you may have. Really worthy is the SpA which will surprise you in a very smooth and elegant environment: it offers only private service, meaning that it is reserved only for you at any time 24H a day!!! Enjoy your stay, it will be great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KLHM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and had a fantastic time. The room was lovely, the reception has dvds you can borrow if you just want ot chillout. The breakfast is continental but plentiful and brought to you in your room if you choose. Great location, very helpful staff and very stylish!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pianode
Reviews.Content: GREETING and CHECK IN --------------------------------------- Hotel Sezz was every bit as wonderful as we hoped it would be. Your comfort is the utmost of importance at hotel Sezz, from the moment you enter the hotel. You are greeted at the entrance by your personal assistant (who is the person you call on for whatever you need during your stay) and led to a comfy seating area (no formal reception desk in sight) where you are offered a glass of champagne and a chance to relax before being given your check in form to check and sign. You are then left to finish your drink in peace and take in your surroundings before being escorted to your room. The hotel is contemporary and modern without being cold and unwelcoming. Yes it is small but they have used the space well and it makes everything that much more intimate. THE ROOM ----------------- What can I say - it was amazing. Like I mentioned before the hotel is small - so the only thing anyone can complain about is the size of the room - but in our case we loved it - so small and intimate, how much space does a couple need? You walk into your room, all very modern and contemporary, ipod dock on the desk, a flat screen TV buried in an alcove across from your bed, a gorgeous large bed in the middle of the room, a love seat in the alcove opposite the bed, French window doors that open out onto the tiny Parisian street the hotel is located on. You're so taken in by the beauty of the room that it takes you a while to realise you can’t see the ensuite bathroom. It is then that your personal assistant flicks a light switch and you see that what you thought was a mirrored wall was actually the glass wall of your bathroom (which had been in complete darkness before). That's when you take in the sight of the amazing Japanese style stone bath and the rest of the gorgeous bathroom. We loved it - especially the long soaks in the bath that was more than big enough for two :o) STAFF ---------- Like I mentioned before there is no reception desk per se like they have in other hotels. Instead the staff are tucked away in a small room but they seem to magically appear the moment you enter the hotel lobby :o) The thing that really sets Hotel Sezz apart from the rest is it's fantastic staff. My fiancé and I have stayed in many 5* hotels in our time and have found that some staff tend to be too formal and cold and can even sometimes look down their noses at you (I don't know if this has anything to do with our age and casual style or just something about us - LOL). The staff at Hotel Sezz could not be more different - they are all welcoming, friendly and professional without any airs and graces about them. They actually all seem to enjoy working there and are truly happy to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. My fiancé proposed to me in our hotel room and the staff had been more than accommodating and helpful - at my fiancé's request they had arranged to get fresh rose petals laid out in a heart shape on the bed and champagne in our room before we returned from a perfect day in Paris and my fiancé popped the question :o) FOOD --------- Breakfast is served in a small room with about 4/5 tables and a wonderful glass ceiling. It is a buffet continental breakfast service with lovely little pastry's, croissants, pain au chocolats, cheeses, hams, yoghurts, fresh fruit and cereals. It's quiet and intimate with no one rushing you along - you are free to sit there and enjoy a leisurely breakfast reading the newspapers (if you so wish).. On our first night we were tired and asked the hotel if they could recommend a good restaurant nearby. They pointed us towards a little French restaurant which was a 5 minute walk away – it was lovely. One night we didn't fancy going out for dinner and were craving a lazy night in with some Pizza (I know what you are thinking - all that fine French cuisine around us and we wanted Pizza) snuggled in our gorgeous room with some DVDs (borrowed from the selection at the front desk). There didn't seem to be any pizza on the room service menu so we spoke to the man on duty at the front desk and he offered to order us a Pizza from the local Domino's and have it delivered to our room. Room service choice was good (it even had sushi), all the food was well presented and tasty. Also for all you chocolate lovers out there - there is a Lenotre store a 5 minute walk from the hotel down avenue au president Kennedy - their cakes and pastries are to die for :o) LOCATION ---------------- For us the location was great as it was out of the way in a quiet part of Paris, which for others may not be ideal. It is located a short walk away from the Eiffel Tower and the Passy metro station is literally around the corner from the hotel so we had no problems getting around and seeing the sites :o) We are the kind of couple who like small boutique hotels - small (in number of rooms) and intimate being the most important to us. In Paris there are many large luxury hotels that would suit others better. However, if you are after small, contemporary, boutique, intimate and friendly then this is definitely the place for you. Highly recommended- it was worth every penny - well done Hotel Sezz

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: sprout64
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sezz is situated in the 16th so off the beaten track but right by the Seine with an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. It's in a quiet side street opposite charming apartments with geranium bedecked balconies, very French. It's boutique and designer with chic but comfortable rooms. My friend's room had a Japanese bath (beautiful but not terribly practical) separated from the bedroom by a full length glass wall. Bathroom products are Kiels and they're generous with them too. Being slightly off the main drag you will need to get taxis into town (10 minutes, 18 Euros at most). What really sets the Sezz apart are the charming people who run it. Magali was managing things when we stayed and is a total delight. We were welcomed with a glass of champagne. She speaks excellent English and helps with any request. Whilst there I was taken ill (entirely my own fault, I wasn't well when I left the UK but thought it would get better). I needed a doctor to be called to the hotel and Louis the night manager was wonderful, taking care of everything calmly and efficiently. Without doubt the team at Sezz are the most charming and helpful I've come across, not just in Paris but in my recent experience of hotels. It's chic, reasonably priced and with lovely staff, do try it.

Reviews.Title: “we liked it”
Reviews.Author: MariaElen
Reviews.Content: Design, comfort, quiet location, great bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - Unprofessional management & service”
Reviews.Author: Berlinsoul
Reviews.Content: After dropping off our luggage and having dinner we returned to our Junior Suite to find out that valuable personal belongings, phones, money were stolen. Neither staff nor management really cared and accused us that we forgot the things in the cab... we wanted to stay four nights in the Junior Suite but decided to leave the hotel asap after what has happened. We never experienced something like that before in a four star hotel. So we can't recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Design, Design, Design.”
Reviews.Author: ADFWomblingFree
Reviews.Content: Wowed by design, heavy on the pocket. We love to stay in cosy boutique hotels, and normally opt for hotels with plenty of old-world charm. This hotel is a mile away from that, but with its slick clean lines, amazing design it really wowed us. All of this comes at a hefty price, and given the location and lack of atmosphere, I'm not sure I can bring myself to recommend it very heartily. In short, if you're familiar with Paris and know where you're booking to stay (for us we found the location not to be a problem because we have friends in the area, but can see how first time visitors would find it a little out of the way), its a great choice for those that want a superior, design centred experience. If you're looking for a more traditional Parisian experience, with leisurely breakfasts, a bustling bar and easy access to the central tourist sights, this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: SnowKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a package for 4 nights in November. I loved the location of Hotel Sezz in a quiet corner of the 16eme arr. in Paris, but conveniently located near a Metro stop and a short walk across the river from the Tour Eiffel. We felt that we were retreating to our quiet home after a long day of wandering, shopping, and whatever else we got up to. The hotel itself was clean and the room very "design", but comfortable. I enjoyed the "fireplace" as we entered, which added warmth to an otherwise fairly stark atmosphere. We took advantage of the HUGE two-person tub in our room on the 7th floor and enjoyed the provided robes and slippers afterwards. The Kiehl's toiletries were wonderful. The bed was comfortable, but a bit hard for my taste, and the springs squeaked loudly from time to time. The curtains were a gorgeous heavy fabric that helped us sleep in by blocking out all light. One thing I did notice was a lot of noise from our neighbors, both as they entered their room (noise from the door) and as they talked (at seemingly normal levels) in their room. As we didn't spend a lot of time in our room, the bother was minimal. Everything in the ground floor Veuve Cliquot bar is overpriced, and we only once saw anyone sitting there sipping champange (they were hotel guests), but breakfast was served in the same room and we enjoyed the large skylights and comfortable booths. Breakfast was good, though twice my request for a cooked egg was ignored or forgotten until we had already finished eating. The basement hammam was lovely, peaceful, and quiet, though the water temperature of the small pool was too cool. We had massages arranged by the hotel with the best masseuse I've ever had. And the entire hammam area was reserved for us privately while we had our massages. This was luxurious. My impression of the hotel was marred by the hit-or-miss service provided by the hotel's concierges. There was one gentleman who provided excellent, timely responses to our requests, and yet with all the others we were left waiting, sometimes for over an hour, for a response to our requests. By email in advance of our trip we made several requests, only to have the people on duty when we arrived to claim no knowledge of what we had already discussed (plans for dinner, etc). They claim to provide one-on-one concierge services for guests throughout their stay, but we must have spoken with at least five different people throughout our stay - and had to fill in the new person with what had already been requested or discussed. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel for its quiet location, lovely furnishings and design, nice hammam facilities, and comfortable bedrooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish With A Lot of Heart”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: I visit Paris three times a year and chose the Sezz because it was in the 16th. But for anyone who is visiting Paris for the first time - you should stay closer to the major attractions. NOW. I loved the hotel on sight - beautiful historic facade and wonderful interior decor. I had flown in from Morocco and the concierge said - you look like you need a Champagne. Far from being a disguised "sale" - he gave me one for free. I ordered room service which was prompt and very good. Loved my room with the huge bath, rain head shower, very comfortable bed and plenty of room. But the next morning really sealed the deal. At breakfast was a young American guy who had been thrown out by his girlfriend and had walked to the nearest hotel - the Sezz. Unfortunately, he had accepted a rate but didn't realise breakfast wasn't included until after he had eaten. Not only was he highly distressed but he was a student without much money and had stretched his budget to the max. The manager simply waived the charge. They allow you to use the internet for free and I was catching a late plane and they allowed me to use the shower in the spa at 6pm before my long flight back to Sydney. All the staff were absolutely fabulous and couldn't do enough. A great choice for frequent visitors to Paris and anyone after a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Business travellers STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Pulundabung
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Paris for a business trip, DO NOT stay at Hotel Sezz. The service is beyond appalling. I rang the concierge at 6:15am to ask them to book a taxi for me to arrive at 7:45 as I had to be at an important meeting at 8:00am. I was told by a very sleepy concierge that they were unable to book a taxi in advance and so they would call 10 mins prior to arrival time. I asked them then to call at 7:25 to be sure the taxi would arrive in plenty of time. At 7:45, when the taxi had not arrived yet, I asked the concierge and he said he was just about to call for a taxi. At 8am, (the time of my meeting) I was told that all the taxis in the area were unavailable and he could do nothing else at this point. I then told him this was ridiculous as I asked for the taxi to be called at 7:25 to which he replied that if he had called at 7:25 it would still have not been at the hotel at 7:45. When I told him that was why I called at 6:15am in the morning, he didn’t believe me and just walked away. I was 45 minutes late for the meeting I had come to Paris to attend and the concierge could not have cared less. They were haughty, rude and smug. I have never met such incompetence and disorganization in a supposed luxury hotel and will never stay at that hotel ever again – regardless of how nice the rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice !”
Reviews.Author: Jojobloc
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to advise you the web site where I booked this hotel. It’s “Splendia”… they write on their home page : “A unique selection of luxury and character hotels”… and I just wanted to say that it’s right ! It was very easy for me to choose my hotel, in the district I wanted… then the booking process is also very simple. Concerning the Hotel Sezz : it was perfect. The staff were really professional. The district was exactly what we was looking for and the hotel corresponded with what we wanted: a mix of trendy and cosy atmosphere. We didn’t take breakfast at the hotel… quite expensive and didn’t look exciting. The room was small but very well decorated. Our view was really nice (3rd floor). We definitively recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but...”
Reviews.Author: hotelguruoslo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed there for one night while we were 'in between' hotels on a recent trip. I personally love hotels that are smaller, stylish and a little different from the usual. Hotel Sezz certainly fits all three. Unfortunately, what it doesn't fit are any criteria regarding convenient location, knowlegeable staff, and nearby good places for breakfast. The room we stayed in (42) was fabulous. The bathroom took up one whole side of the room separated from the bed area by a floor to ceiling glass wall - toilet was around the corner, hidden from view if you were wondering. The shower was incredible. It was a limestone-lined square japanese-style tub (that we used as such) with a rain shower head. The sink, although very stylish, was not very practical. Bed was comfortable. Room decor, like the hotel, was of high quality. However, the problems. 1. As previously stated by many other guests, the location is very inconvenient for anyone wanting to see more than the 16th. The hotel has only one metro stop nearby that is actually not very well connected to the other lines (a rarity in Paris). Yes, it is only a 10-15 min walk to the Eiffel Tower but, really, who wants to go there to be smothered by tourists and gizmo salesmen when there are so many other beautiful sights to be seen? 2. The staff. Every one was extremely nice and personable. However, their helpfulness and success in filling the 'concierge' role (something you should expect for this type and cost of hotel) have a lot of room for improvement. For example, they could not think of any good restaurants we could go to (even with our suggestion of where we wanted to go - the Joel Robuchon restaurants), did not ask to help with reservations, their suggestion of a breakfast place lead us to a restaurant only open for lunch etc etc. In the end, we ended up going back to our 'tried and true' places we knew from previous trips (booked by us) - a diasppointment from such a nice, hip boutique hotel. Small, hip places tend to attract a clientele that likes similar things in restaurants and bars. Cater to your demographic! 3. The 'champagne bar', comprising a few tables and chairs that, when you could actually flag down someone working there, you could sit at and drink your 15euro glass of champagne. No thanks. We could buy ourselves a bottle and stare at each other drinking in our fabulous room instead. In the end, in a city like Paris, where there are so many fabulous small boutique hotels in more active parts of the city for similar cost, I kicked myself for booking in at the Sezz. I'm not usually one to obsess or be concerned about spending money on nice hotels but I found myself thinking about what I could have gotten elsewhere (d'Aubusson for example) for the same price. Not a good feeling upon checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Decor for a Parisian stay”
Reviews.Author: vette10
Reviews.Content: Initially a bit skeptical, and not sure what to expect because of the previous reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised! The service was standard but the amenties, decor ( Especially the steam room and spa) were absolutely fabulous and we would definitely stay again. Hint: Ask for any room ending in 2 ( 32, 42, etc) and you'll get a room with the japanese style bath and glass encased bath...A++ for the Decor and location...5 minutes maybe 10 to base of the eiffel tower. If the weather permits, rent a bicycle for 15Euros per day from Fat tire tours. A really awesome way to explore a "bike friendly" city. We LOVED it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pluses, few minuses”
Reviews.Author: Marcyjohn
Reviews.Content: Like the previous reviewer, my wife and I stayed at Hotel Sezz over New Years in a junior suite. We were there a total of 6 nights and were primarily focused on seeing a few museums, doing a little shopping, and mainly enjoying the fabulous Parisian restaurants and cafes. We travel extensively for both pleasure and business, and tend to prefer stylish boutique hotels like Sezz over "grand dames" like Crillon or Meurice. Some of our favorites over the years have been the Morrison Hotel in Dublin, the Mandarin Oriental in both San Francisco and New York, Luxe11 in Berlin, and the Metropolitan in Bangkok. Regarding Hotel Sezz, I would concur with everything the previous reviewer wrote, so I won't reiterate those points, but rather add a few pluses and minuses of my own: 1. Location. The 16th is definitely off the radar for most tourists, which is a blessing and a curse. We quickly found our breakfast spot at the Cafe Passy on the intersection of rue Passy and av B. Franklin, about 5 minutes' walk above the hotel. In fact, this area had all the services one might require, including a dry cleaners, pharmacy, several restaurants, etc. The only issue is that you must climb a fairly steep flight of stairs at the head of ave Fremiet to get to that part of Passy. There is also a fun cafe/bar just under the bridge on ave Kennedy below the Passy metro stop on ave Kennedy that was just minutes from the hotel. In addition, it's an easy 20-30 minute walk from the hotel to the Trocadero via ave Franklin, and then on to ave Montaigne for shopping in one of Paris's finest areas. So, though the 16th is maybe a little far afield for some, it is still a fine neighborhood and a good choice if you want to be away from the tourist ghettos on the left bank or around the Louvre. For most people, I suspect the biggest downside to the 16th is that you must take the metro to get to most of the main tourist attractions in the city. I happen to love trains and subways, so this isn't a downside for me. My wife and I invested in a 7 day metro/bus pass (cost: 16E/person) at the RTF kiosk across from the Tourist Information kiosk at Gare du Nord and we were set for the week. After a couple of days spent getting to know the various lines, we were navigating the metro like old pros. One last caveat about the location, though. It is a tough trip from Gare du Nord to the Passy metro stop if you have large bags. There are lots of steps and not many escalators in the metro, so seriously consider the 20E taxi ride from the train station as a back-saving alternative. 2. The hotel "amenities."
