We loved the concierges and found them extremely helpful, but some of the marketing materials are really misleading. Since I'd read about the champagne bar/breakfast nook, I wasn't terribly disappointed in the Grand Dame. However, I did think that a few people might be around the "bar" for New Years, since it is supposedly a Veuve Clicquoit-sponsored establishment. They should really try a little harder to do something with the bar, since it would be a nice addition to the hotel. Both my wife and I are gym people, so we were really disappointed that the nearest gym facility was 3 metro stops away and costs 30 E per day per person! Yikes!! I made due with running the stairs a couple of times, doing situps and pushups, and skipping rope. On the other hand, we used the hotel's DVD library several times and found it a lifesaver on the one night that we came in early after an exhausting day of tramping around the Marais in cold, overcast weather. 3. The bed and the bath. I found the bed to be particularly comfortable. So much so that I had trouble getting up on the colder mornings of our stay! The bath, a huge circular double tub, was used by one or the other (or both) of us 4 nights out of 6. It was the perfect thing for relaxing after a long winters' day of touring, shopping and dining. 4. The "Look." As I'd mentioned earlier, we tend to prefer boutique hotels like Sezz for our travels, so the high design aspect really worked for us. I can easily see how some would find it a little cold or too spare. However, the staff seems to really go out of their way to make you comfortable and welcome. All in all, I'd definitely stay at Sezz on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sezz Who”
Reviews.Author: CharlieLondon
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with my stay here. When I booked I had booked a rate including breakfast and when I checked in the girl said it was NOT included. When I checked out several days later the bill showed it was included. As it was already a discounted rate there wasn't anything they were willing to do. As far as butler service??? That's just a ridiculas statement! The girl who checked me in was new and didn't know how anything worked (ex booking the spa, how to turn on the lights to show me the spa, the wireless internet.... on and and on. She also didn't know the immediate area for ATM, bakery, market etc.... For this type of hotel and price they really should have had her accompanied by someone who knew what they were doing. I eventually asked her to go get someone because I was sick of hearing "I don't know". They didn't say sorry, quite the opposite. They acted like how dare I disturb them. The hotel is definately stylish, but dark and when looking closer it's very tired. The "spa" however was amazing. It's not really a spa in the traditional way. If you want massage you need to book 3 days in advance because no one is actually on staff that does it. If your only staying 3 days guess your out of luck! lol When you book the 'spa area' you get it all to yourself and there is a beautiful stone jacuzzi, showers with huge shower heads and a steam room. Just incredible. I've been to Paris many times and every neighborhood is different and like I said it was a huge disappointment to stay somewhere where they didn't seem to know much about where and how to go... And like the other reviewer said the standard room was so TINY. (Fair enough, it' s Paris, but it was not like the pictures at all). Yes I know the website is to entice, but this one is totally misleading. Location was good because it's 2 minutes walk to the metro, so I didn't understand why people wrote it wasn't good. There are also lots of nice shops/bakeries very close by. The bar they mentioned makes the place sound hip, but it was always empty and the time I did decide to have a glass of champage I had to track someone down to order it. It was alright, but for the price I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “an expensive treat”
Reviews.Author: 32female
Reviews.Content: the hotel Sezz is ultra modern and very chic and you feel that you are staying somewhere prettty special when you walk in through the front doors. Don't be fooled by the pictures on the hotel website however as it gives the impression that all rooms have the glass fronted bathroom and the bed artisticly placed in the midlle of the room etc. Our room was a standard double which although the cheapest of the rates - was substantially expensive! The room is well designed, very modern but a lot smaller than I was led to believe from any of the photos on the website. The bed however was huge and the wall-mounted LCD television and dvd player were great touches. The bathroom also was smaller than any of the website photos but still beautifully designed with some very unique finishes. The bathrobes however, god knows what happened there! they look as if someone had put them in the tumble dryer for 5 hours, both of them were so small. We stayed for 3 nights and we treated ourselves to continental breakfast on the final day hoping to keep hunger at bay for our travel home! Seriously not worth the money - 50 euros for 2!!! we got 2 boiled eggs, a small basket of very small pastries and a bruised apple and a bruised orange, oh and tea with hot milk! not exactly a lot to keep the hunger pangs at bay. I would defnitely save your money and go and find a nice cafe! we also ordered room service one night as we were going on a tour to the moulin rouge (definitely worth a vist) we booked through a link on the Eurostar website which is then booked through Paris Vision) Anway the room service is pretty mediocre. Warmed up microwave meals, which is fair enough seeing as the hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but at 15 euros a plate is a little inflated for what you get! All in all, definitely a hotel worth visiting, it's one of the most uniquely designed hotels I've ever visited and it's in a great location just round the corner from the Passy Metro which is handy for getting everywhere in Paris. The Eiffel Tower is also within walking distance so great for identifying where you need to get back to!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel in Paris !!!”
Reviews.Author: fashion-traveller
Reviews.Content: This was really an amazing experience... I firstly wanna say that I stay every month in Paris for business, so I tried many hotels in that city. The Sezz hotel is really the best hotel I stayed in Paris: It's in a quiet private street (important, because the Paris streets never sleeps...) and there is safe car parking there. To check-in, no desk, but a comfortable design "fauteuil" to wait for the key, and a drink was offered to us. The private butler brought us to our room... and as it was a quiet period, the gave us a free upgrade to junior suite. Everything was so perfect, the bed, the pillows, the flat screen, DVD, LED-lightning everywhere... Very design, but warm and friendly design. The bathroom was CLEAN, not one fingerprint on the mirror ! the tub was round, we could take a bath with four in that tub! The quality and finition of the materials and bathroom is perfect. You have a private butler who really take care of everything... One night, we wanted to use the SPA, and we had it private for us alone! The SPA is surprising, jaccuzzi in natural stone, hammam, massage room... great! I stayed mostly in following hotels in Paris: Ritz, Westminster, 123,... but this one is particular. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!!

Reviews.Title: “Supereb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmah1
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for the weekend as a present for my Boyfriend's Birthday. I stumbled across Hotel Sezz whilst researching on the internet. After reading the reviews on this website I did not hesitate in booking us into Hotel Sezz for 2 nights. This Hotel is absolutely phenomenal. However if you are not into Contemporary design or small boutique hotels then it is probably not the right choice for yourself. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly member of staff who showed us into the sleek champagne bar and gave us our complimentary champagne. We were then given a phone which we could use 24 hours if we needed any help what so ever. Our room was exceptional, A double bed in the middle of the room, plasma TV with a bathroom divided by a glass window and door (don't worry the toilet is tucked away to keep privacy). The bath is a double bath as well. Each room in the hotel is different. Our room was room 22. If you call the hotel you can request them to keep a room of your choice available. We asked to have a tour of the other rooms. We saw the Eiffel tower suite, but the room was not a lot different from ours other than the view of the tower. If you are wanting a view of the Tower then this room is superb, but if you are looking for a larger room for the extra money then do not book the suite as it is near enough the same size. The room below 65 was a standard double and had a view of the tower through the roofs which would be a better option. This Hotel is tucked down a side street. It is a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower and really conveniently located. We spent one evening in the hotel. The staff bent over backwards to help us. They ordered us take away as we were far to tired to sit in a restaurant, were giving us souvenirs to take home, they really bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. This Hotel is ideal if you are looking for a quiet hotel to escape to after a busy day sightseeing in London. This Hotel is an excellent Boutique hotel. If you’re looking for a busy, bustling hotel, with a large restaurant etc then this is probably not the best choice, but if you’re looking for a contemporary hotel with friendly staff and a modern outlook then this is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Generally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: willawson
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently visited Sezz over a weekend and were disappointed. We had booked a suite at some considerable cost for both a Friday and Saturday night expecting to have a room with a semi roof top view as described on the website and booking form, this was unfortunately not the case. All we had was an enclosed courtyard to look out on, which would have been fine if we had been expecting that. We arrived at around 10pm and were looking forward to relaxing and ordering some room service. There was only one member of staff on call for the whole hotel that night, and for such an expensive boutique hotel this seemed rather inadequate. We tried to order room service from the menu provided but were told at 1015 that half the menu was unavailable as it was too late to order (the cut off time stated was 1030pm). We were forced to order from the 24hr menu, which on the whole looked fine. When we spoke to the lone member of staff he did apologise for the fact that he was on his own but that’s not something a guest should have to hear. He eventually brought our food up after explaining that it would take some time for him to prepare?! When the food arrived it was still in the cardboard microwave containers!!! This was totally unacceptable presentation and 3 microwave pasta dishes for 45 euros was bordering on ridiculous. The robes in the room were totally below standard also. They didn’t match and one was so small it was like a child’s. The dvd player was stored in a separate room to the TV and could only be accessed via opening the wardrobe. The bath wasn’t big enuff for two people as stated on the website, and those are not marble sinks you see in the pictures, they are plastic. Having said all that, the shower was extremely good and was easily the best feature in the bathroom. Over all this experience has put me off going back to Sezz. For the amount of money a suite costs for a weekend stay, I generally expect a lot more from such a contemporary and luxury hotel, we were both very disappointed and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “« Good hotel, one bad experience »”
Reviews.Author: PIXSQUARED
Reviews.Content: My husband had to work in Paris, so we have been to the Sezz 5 or 6 times. We really enjoy the hotel regarding the architecture and design as well as the service (I do not like the bar design). The owner is a very nice and interesting guy. The guests can be classified in the young international pretty people. However, my husband almost get electrocuted one time when getting in the bathroom…there was a flood coming from the upper room. And unfortunately the Dutch manager did not at all take the problem seriously nor apologize or did any thing she should have.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, but inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: razlon
Reviews.Content: Good service I found the room to be a little over-designed, a bit dark and empty The bathroom was nice (round bath) and the sink pretty but a pain to use. Location not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LJT18
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Paris we stayed in Hotel Sezz and it was amazing. Truly magnificent. I loved everything about it.....stylish room, perfect location, helpful staff. Although the city itself is lovely the hotel (and my boyfriend) definitely made the trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sezz Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 6, avenue Fremiet, 75016 Paris, France
